answers.answer: Yes I just did my 3 gtt yesterday i'm scared..still waiting for the results...good luck to u tho
I failed 1 hour. It a borderline on my 3 hour. So I have to go back AGAIN on next Friday to do the 3 hour again. :( such a long test! Bring a good book like a birthing book or something.
I failed my one hour and just took the 3 hour on Wednesday. I haven't heard back from them so I'm hoping I passed. They said no call is usually good news. Good luck :)
thanks! im really nervous but hopefully everything comes back well
I failed my 3 hour test :( but have been able to control the gestational diabetes with diet alone. I just have to limit my carb intake but can still have treats now and then.
Just a question... Is it tru that a percentage of woman.. do develop diabetes type 2 after having gestational diabetes n giving birth?????? I'm concerned

@jusshadababy3112 "The blood sugar (glucose) level usually returns to normal after delivery." thats from a govt medical webpage on gestational diabetes. im hoping  the first test was just a fluke because i dont have any of the normal risk factors for gestational diabetes
Gestational diabetes is just that, it does not mean you will have diabetes after giving birth.  If you fail the test, I would retest, it's inaccurate a lot of the time.

My gestational diabetes specialist said that if you have gestational diabetes you are more likely to get type 2 diabetes 8-10 years after giving birth. This was true for my mother as she had gestational diabetes with me, didn't have it with y brother, and when I was around 9 she got diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.
I failed my one hour; and passed my three hour it freaked me out but I got through it try not to stess to much ur baby senses everything

question: I got a call ffrom my ob that i failed my one hour glucose tolerance test and that i have to go monday for a 3 hour. Has thid happened to anyone else before. Im really anxious i hadnt eaten for even longer then instructed..
title: failed gtt
